message: This is my favorite thing to have happen to a game. You're settled in, firm in your game-knowledge and confident that you're in the top two-thirds of players. You're the man. Suddenly, there's an enormous influx of new players! Delight delight, you're suddenly awash in kill-streaks, scoring headshots, backstabs, and carpet bombs left and right. Jake Tessem has the details in his article on our site http://tehpwngaming.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=159%3Ajt6-29-11&catid=47%3Alast-added-tutorilas&Itemid=56 - what do you think?
Personally, until a week ago, I couldn't imagine every playing TF2 again. All of a sudden, I'm enticed. Is it wrong to hear the wails of poor players as a modern siren song?

Definitely was spoiled by playing with a lot of really talented players the first few years after release.  It's a good move for exposure, but finding a good public server now is a pain in the ass.  It was enough trouble trying to find a game where people cared more about playing than allchat and trading hats.  Now it's even harder -.-;  Hopefully I'll be able to find the time for some pugs.
